snippet: The automaker reported a rare bit of good news on Tuesday, with sales up 1 percent, and said its annual selling rate remained in line with its forecast.
abstract: General Motors, embroiled in safety crisis that has led to recall of 29 million vehicles worldwide, announces that its sales in June rose by 1 percent over same month year earlier, to 267,461 vehicles sold; numbers are keeping in pace with overall strong industry performance.
lead_paragraph: The automaker reported a rare bit of good news on Tuesday, with sales up 1 percent, and said its annual selling rate remained in line with its forecast.

headline.main: G.M. Sales Rise as Buyers Ignore Recalls
headline.print_headline: Buyers Ignore G.M. Recalls, as Sales Rise
